location.zh-cn: 中华民国台北市松山区
location.en: Songshan District, Taipei, Republic of China

description.zh-cn: 位于中华民国台北市松山区的军民合用机场，1936年启用，为台湾第一座机场。民用部分为台北国际航空站，军用部分为空军松山基地。
description.en: A joint civil-military airport located in Songshan District, Taipei, Republic of China. Opened in 1936, it was the first airport in Taiwan. The civilian part is the Taipei International Airport, and the military part is the Songshan Air Force Base.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国交通部下属机构，负责管理民用航空事务。
description.en: An agency under the Ministry of Transportation and Communications of the Republic of China, responsible for managing civil aviation affairs.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国国军的航空部队。
description.en: The aerial warfare branch of the Republic of China Armed Forces.

description.zh-cn: 台湾日治时期的最高统治机关。
description.en: The highest ruling body in Taiwan during the period of Japanese rule.

description.zh-cn: 位于台湾桃园市的国际机场，为台湾最主要的国际客运和货运枢纽。
description.en: An international airport in Taoyuan, Taiwan, serving as the primary international passenger and cargo hub for Taiwan.

description.zh-cn: 1970年代在台湾进行的一系列国家级基础建设工程。
description.en: A series of national-level infrastructure projects undertaken in Taiwan during the 1970s.

description.zh-cn: 指马英九担任中华民国总统期间的行政团队。
description.en: Refers to the executive team during Ma Ying-jeou's presidency of the Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 已歇业的台湾航空公司。
description.en: A defunct Taiwanese airline.

description.zh-cn: 已停飞的台湾航空公司。
description.en: A grounded Taiwanese airline.

description.zh-cn: 台湾政治人物，曾任立法委员、环保署署长等职。
description.en: A Taiwanese politician who served as a legislator and head of the Environmental Protection Administration.

description.zh-cn: 台湾政治人物，曾任立法委员。
description.en: A Taiwanese politician who served as a legislator.

description.zh-cn: 台湾政治人物、会计师，曾任立法委员。
description.en: A Taiwanese politician and accountant who served as a legislator.

description.zh-cn: 台湾政治人物、医师，曾任台北市市长。
description.en: A Taiwanese politician and physician who served as Mayor of Taipei.

description.zh-cn: 台湾学者，国立政治大学地政学系教授。
description.en: A Taiwanese scholar and professor in the Department of Land Economics at National Chengchi University.

description.zh-cn: 一架复兴航空班机从台北松山机场起飞后不久坠毁于基隆河的空难事件。
description.en: An air disaster in which a TransAsia Airways flight crashed into the Keelung River shortly after taking off from Taipei Songshan Airport.

description.zh-cn: 印度独立运动领导人，自由印度临时政府的领导人。
description.en: An Indian nationalist leader and head of the Provisional Government of Free India.

description.zh-cn: 一架中华航空班机在进场台北松山机场时因天候不佳撞山坠毁的空难事件。
description.en: An air disaster in which a China Airlines flight crashed into a mountain due to bad weather while on approach to Taipei Songshan Airport.

description.zh-cn: 台北松山机场的民用部分“台北国际航空站”由交通部民用航空局管理。
description.en: The civilian part of Taipei Songshan Airport, 'Taipei International Airport', is managed by the Civil Aeronautics Administration.

description.zh-cn: 台北松山机场的军用部分“空军松山基地”隶属于中华民国空军。
description.en: The military part of Taipei Songshan Airport, 'Songshan Air Force Base', is subordinate to the Republic of China Air Force.

description.zh-cn: 台湾总督府于1936年设立了台北松山机场，当时称为“台北飞行场”。
description.en: The Governor-General of Taiwan established Taipei Songshan Airport in 1936, then known as 'Taihoku Airfield'.

description.zh-cn: 台湾桃园国际机场是中华民国政府在1970年代推动的十大建设之一。
description.en: Taiwan Taoyuan International Airport was one of the Ten Major Construction Projects promoted by the ROC government in the 1970s.

description.zh-cn: 1979年桃园国际机场启用后，松山机场的国际航线业务转移至桃园机场，其角色转为以服务国内航班为主。
description.en: After the opening of Taoyuan International Airport in 1979, Songshan Airport's international route services were transferred to Taoyuan, and its role shifted to primarily serving domestic flights.

description.zh-cn: 马英九政府上台后，将松山机场重新定位为首都商务机场，并重启国际与两岸航线。
description.en: After the Ma Ying-jeou administration came to power, it repositioned Songshan Airport as a capital business airport and reopened international and cross-strait routes.

description.zh-cn: 复兴航空于2016年11月22日起停飞所有航线，结束了在松山机场的营运。
description.en: TransAsia Airways ceased all flights from November 22, 2016, ending its operations at Songshan Airport.

description.zh-cn: 远东航空于2019年12月13日起停飞所有航线，结束了在松山机场的营运。
description.en: Far Eastern Air Transport ceased all flights from December 13, 2019, ending its operations at Songshan Airport.

description.zh-cn: 李应元在2002年参选台北市长时曾提出废除松山机场的政见。
description.en: In his 2002 campaign for Taipei Mayor, Lee Ying-yuan proposed the closure of Songshan Airport.

description.zh-cn: 姚文智在2014年参与台北市长初选时再次提出废除松山机场的政见，并在复兴航空空难后重申此主张。
description.en: Pasuya Yao reiterated his proposal to close Songshan Airport during his 2014 Taipei mayoral primary campaign, and re-emphasized this position after the TransAsia Airways crash.

description.zh-cn: 罗淑蕾在复兴航空235号班机空难后，指松山机场是世界上最危险的机场之一，应予以淘汰或迁移。
description.en: After the TransAsia Airways Flight 235 crash, Lo Shu-lei described Songshan Airport as one of the world's most dangerous airports and called for it to be decommissioned or relocated.

description.zh-cn: 台北市长柯文哲曾表示计划于2020年将松山机场废除。
description.en: Taipei Mayor Ko Wen-je had expressed plans to close Songshan Airport by 2020.

description.zh-cn: 徐世荣在复兴航空空难后撰文反对迁移松山机场，认为不应借机炒作迁址话题。
description.en: Following the TransAsia Airways crash, Hsu Shih-jung wrote in opposition to relocating Songshan Airport, arguing that the tragedy should not be exploited to push for its move.

description.zh-cn: 复兴航空235号班机空难发生后，姚文智再次强调松山机场非迁不可。
description.en: After the crash of TransAsia Airways Flight 235, Pasuya Yao reiterated his call that Songshan Airport must be relocated.

description.zh-cn: 此次空难严重打击了复兴航空的声誉和营运，是其最终于2016年停业的原因之一。
description.en: This air disaster severely damaged the reputation and operations of TransAsia Airways, contributing to its eventual shutdown in 2016.

description.zh-cn: 中华航空206号班机在进场台北松山机场的过程中发生空难。
description.en: China Airlines Flight 206 crashed during its approach to Taipei Songshan Airport.
